item.title: Rant on html5 and h1 in articles
item.description: I was using Firefox’s reading mode on my site one day and thought some stuff looked off. Then I remembered: semantic elements. Maybe that’s why my site sometimes looks weird in reading mode!

item.title: About
item.description: I dunno who’d be interested enough to view this page â€” or heck, even this website â€” but whatever. You’re here. If you’d like to learn more about me, see my home page or visit some of my links there.

item.title: 88x31 buttons
item.description: From what I figure, apparently there was something called Geocities back in the mid-90s to the 2000s. People joined online ‘cities’ and made personal websites. One of the things people would add into their sites were these 88x31 images, which sometimes contained links.

item.title: Anotherrr archive
item.description: Back in 2021, I used to have this website called anotherrr.web.app, made with a Static Site Generator I made myself. Due to the horrible codebase, it has since become adandoned. But I’m still quite fond of the content I wrote for it and wish to give those old posts a new home in this site.

item.title: Why I made a website
item.description: Short answer: why not? The longer answer is me waxing poetic. I’ve made a website long long ago, back in 2021. (In fact, you can still see what remains of it here.

item.title: This post will trigger you
item.description: What? Why did you click on that link? ðŸ¤” I honestly don’t know what you think you’ll find in here, but it’s definitely not what you’re looking for. I don’t even know why you’re bothering to scroll down and read this content, why you’re still here reading this very sentence.

item.title: Why Python is better than JavaScript
item.description: Something a lot of beginners ask. When you begin exposure to the world of programming languages, you’ll probably hear JavaScript a lot. Until you hear about another language: Python.

item.title: About this website
item.description: Yeah, well, most 14 year olds don’t make their own personal websites (that aren’t for school of course)… but I do (I do…), and it’s for random purposes. It’s a long story, really.
